Dialogue: Merry Widow, uh, echo whiskey niner ait fife. Man overboard. Man overboard. Emergency assistance required. Position --

Dialogue: O'Shea, I take it you've left already because if you haven't, you're late. That ferry gets in at nine.

Dialogue: So you can have my desk while I'm gone. O'Shea will tell you, 'tis mostly administrative, processing permits and that sort. You might catch the odd bit of commotion every now and then but half the island's leaving for the show in Dungary so it'll be dead all weekend.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: I'm sure we can find something to do.

Dialogue: You're only gone two weeks.      I can handle two weeks.

Speaker: kenifick
Dialogue: I'm coming, I'm coming.    Right, I'm off.

Speaker: kenifick
Dialogue: Rightio. Reports and files in the top drawer, anything you need, O'Shea will be here to show you round. O'Shea?

Speaker: kenifick
Dialogue: Won't go far with no tickets.    See you in a fortnight. Be good.

Speaker: tadhg
Dialogue: Oh ya bastard, Paddy!      Ya knew it was gonna do that.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Well you can relax, there's none of that here.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: You never know. It's the quiet places where all the mad shit happens. Just open a paper.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: I bet you haven't missed a day of work in your life.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: And should I be ashamed of that?

Dialogue: I'd prefer it if you'd introduce me as Garda Nolan.

Dialogue: Smith's a marine psychologist or something, did I get that right?

Dialogue: So how long are you here?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Oh, wonderful. Wonderful.   Are you staying nearby?

Dialogue: Well they're pilot whales. It happens with them from time to time but no one really knows why.

Dialogue: That'll do, boys.    Pack it up.

Dialogue: Oh, right. Well, I have a key so ... see you Monday then.

Dialogue: You would! If you were to know what I know you'd want to know.

Dialogue: Right, between you and me, I caught meself a sea monster today.

Dialogue: Ah I'm joking, you know that.   One more, huh?

Dialogue: Come on down for a drink.

Dialogue: It doesn't matter out here.   No one will know.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: I am not.    I'm sober as a judge.

Dialogue: Is that so? Say the alphabet backwards for me.

Dialogue: I haven't a clue. I've never seen anything like it. It's a completely foreign species. I can't even begin to originate or class it.

Dialogue: Toothis. It's a rare deep sea squid but this isn't that, not in Irish waters. No, this is something totally different. Something ... alien.  In that it's undocumented.

Dialogue: -- When I tried to clean some dirt off of it --

Dialogue: I stood on it a few times.

Dialogue: All this thing needs to survive is blood ... and water.

Dialogue: We think there might be another one of those things, at least one anyway.

Dialogue: I think we've got at least two missing persons. We need to take a look.

Dialogue: Uh huh.   Of course you are.

Dialogue: Careful. Once it's wet I don't know what it can do.

Dialogue: If those eggs hatch, with no whales to eat --

Dialogue: It took three of us to get that thing off me.

Dialogue: This place has gone to the dogs.

Dialogue: Because Paddy was so intoxicated his blood-alcohol level was toxic.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Exactly. If we taint our blood with booze, we're poisonous to eat.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: And you told me to cut back.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: We have just one night where we have to deal with this on our own. Tomorrow, we'll be sorted. Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Are we for real?    Are YOU for real? Show him.

Dialogue: That's just the tip of the blood sucking iceberg.

Dialogue: I give up.     Yes, a Grabber.

Dialogue: But if its allergic to booze can't we just hose 'em with vodka or some shit?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Because alcohol is a poison. It needs to be ingested to take affect. Also to preserve specimens I keep them in an alcohol based solution. Just like with this one, right now.

Dialogue: So what if we sprayed whiskey in its mouth?

Dialogue: Feck that.     A waste of whiskey.

Dialogue: If you want to get that close to it, good luck.

Dialogue: Great. It's her birthday next week now she thinks this is something for her.

Dialogue: How drunk are we talking here?

Dialogue: You're gone off your game, boy.

Dialogue: No offence but I don't think my body can handle Paddy levels.

Dialogue: If those things do come for us, we'd be lambs to the slaughter if bombed out of our brains.

Dialogue: And with everyone hammered there's no one in a fit state to call the shots. The non-alcoholic shots.

Dialogue: But what's to keep us safe from ourselves, forget what's outside, we could fall over and break our necks trying to conga. Statistics prove put a large number of people in a confined space, ply them with booze and --

Dialogue: This will work. And I'll keep order. I won't be drinking.

Dialogue: Thanks.  Only one of us need risk it and I know these people and this island better than you. It should be me.

Dialogue: I see what you're doing here but have you forgotten you're a dependent alcoholic organising a piss up in a brewery! I'll do it. It'll be easier.

Dialogue: Lisa, I'm good to no one when I drink. I know that. So do you.     I can do this.

Dialogue: A bird never flew on one wing.

Dialogue: When this is over we need to talk.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Ah come off it, this could save all our lives yet.

Dialogue: OK, now we know what we gotta do. Keep our blood alcohol levels at point two.

Dialogue: You're looking at up to ten pints each depending on height and weight.

Dialogue: We'll have to do shots. Properly tear the arse out of it.

Dialogue: Who's going to pay for all this by the way?

Dialogue: Mass has ended, go in peace to love and serve the Lord. Amen.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: It's Fr Potts last mass, so everyone that didn't leave yesterday for the thing in Dungary.

Dialogue: Father, do you mind if I say a few words?

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Can I have your attention please?

Dialogue: Folks, just a quick announcement, at Maher's Tavern tonight we're having a bit of a shindig and you're all coming to join us for what will be a great night's craic!

Dialogue: Who needs a reason to have a laugh?

Dialogue: It's a welcome party for me.

Dialogue: A welcome party? But you're leaving in a fortnight.

Dialogue: So it's a goodbye party.    Whatever.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: -- Hey bucko! Where are you going? This party's for your benefit. And all of you are gonna be there too. It's the law!

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: What Garda Nolan means is we'd love your company. There's no point going home to a cold, empty house in weather like tonight when we'll be right across the street from here and we'll have music and craic and company -- and a FREE BAR!

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: That's the spirit! So c'mon, it's a party and the drinks are on us!

Dialogue: And a board with a nail in it.

Dialogue: I've got a hurley and a pellet gun.

Dialogue: What are we gonna do with a pellet gun?

Dialogue: Shoot pellets. But I don't have any pellets.

Dialogue: Great, well you can just wave it at them then.

Dialogue: C.P.S. forty-one hundred pump action twin jet Super Soaker. Shoots twenty feet. The nephew's.

Dialogue: Una told me, how she died.    I'm so sorry.

Dialogue: I didn't drink back then. No, she met someone else. It happens.

Dialogue: Yeah, yeah. How much would you say you lost? Would I be right in thinking you're around fourteen stone?

Dialogue: No? Fifteen? Yeah, I better go with fifteen to be safe.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Ya haven't touched your pint.    Ya gonna finish it?

Speaker: dr gleeson
Dialogue: C'mon, c'mon. Is some bloke doin' his makeup or what?

Speaker: dr gleeson
Dialogue: Ah, feck the likes of this.

Speaker: dr gleeson
Dialogue: Get it off! Get it off!

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: WAIT!    Oh Jesus Mary Mother of God.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: AHH, THE OTHER WAY!      THE OTHER WAY!

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: I'm not feeling so good.     I need a drink to calm me nerves.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: I can't drive with you shaking me.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Put your foot on the clutch!

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: I am arresting you for the murder of Doctor Gleeson. You are not obliged to say anything unless you wish to do so, but whatever you say will be taken down in writing and may be given in evidence.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: BRIAN, GET THE DOOR, OPEN THE DOOR!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Nearly. Put the other light away. ... Stall on now. That's it ...

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Brian, forget that help us barricade the door.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: All right you ugly bollocks, have some of this shit!

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: That's gonna blow!   Get rid of it!

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Is this what I'm like when I'm drunk?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Unless someone goes outside to change the kegs, we're done drinking for the night.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I was just gettin' a taste for it.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Folks, listen carefully. We're moving this party upstairs.

Speaker: fr potts
Dialogue: Ah now, what kind of party is this?

Speaker: fisherman
Dialogue: Someone better tell us what's really going on here? Right now!

Speaker: una
Dialogue: This party isn't for me, is it, Brian?! You lied to me!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: You see you! This is your fault. You brought that thing on the island.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Ah relax. You'll give yourself angina.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: I'll give ya angina.    Outside, now! I claim ya!

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Right you are! I'm sick of your bollocks.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Paddy! Brian! Cop on, I'm asking ya! Now's not the time for this.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Don't worry, we have it all under control. There's nothing trying to kill you.

Speaker: mamie
Dialogue: Thanks be to Jesus, let me out of here!

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Get back! Smith, what are you doing? Smith!

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Smith, listen to me. It's bigger than you think. Get back inside now! Please, I'm begging you.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: I need a picture with it. For National Geographic. And Facebook.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Feck your photos, change the kegs!  What? He's flutered, sure he'll be fine. G'wan, Smith! Fine fella y'are!

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Steady. You don't want to eat me. I'm ripped to the tits!

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: See! I told you. It's just an animal, it doesn't want to hur--

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Everyone, stay calm.    They can't get up here.

Speaker: fr potts
Dialogue: And what in the name of fuck were those things?

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Has anyone been bitten?  You haven't been bitten because of the alcohol you've been drinking. They're allergic to drunk people. So there's no need to panic, we're safe up here. Has anyone got a mobile on them?

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Call the mainland. Call the Coastguard. Call whoever you can get through to.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: It's just linen and cleaning stuff. Nothing we can really use.

Speaker: fisherman
Dialogue: Why can't ya just shoot it?     Ye guys must have some guns.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: We're the Gardai. Not the LAPD.  An Garda Siochana will succeed not by force of arms or numbers, but on their moral authority as servants of the people.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Something's not right.   It can't be that hungry.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: It's the female. It's following her scent. Sure didn't she slime you in the lab? Like with me bathroom and Tadhg Murphy.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: No, no, Tadhg Murphy's fine. He's at the festival on the mainland.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: It's swinging one of Tommy Riordan's sheep at the door.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: My cat does that, then leaves it on the doorstep as a present.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: What the hell does that mean?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: It'll try to mount you, somehow. Failing that it'll most likely rip you limb from limb in frustration.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Grand.   Ah sure what can ya do.

Speaker: hilda
Dialogue: Oh, God.     What does it want?

Speaker: una
Dialogue: It's not gonna stop, is it? We won't survive the night. We're on a sinking ship.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Too drunk to drive a car but not drunk enough. We're sobering up. All of us.

Speaker: una
Dialogue: We can't just sit here. It'll bring the walls down around us.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: What if we threw a bomb at it?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Have you got semtex on you?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: How about we like push it off a cliff or something.

Speaker: una
Dialogue: Or electrocute it?   I don't know.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I vote we feed it Father Potts. Unless it eats shit it'll choke to death.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Feck, is he in here? I was joking, Father. I apologise.

Speaker: una
Dialogue: If we can't destroy it, what can we do?

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: OK, we know it does two things: it drinks blood and it breathes water. We took away one, we could take away the other.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: We need to keep it away from water. Dry it out somehow.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: There's got to be some way we can stop it, fight fire with fire.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: The Grabber! Not the Grabber- Grabber, the mechanical one!  The big yoke, with the arm and the thing and you know? That big aul whatchamacallit you crush things with. The feckin' thing at Cooney's site! What's it called?

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Exactly! With that thing you could grab it, hoist it up and trap it. It's raining now but it has to stop some time right? And when it does it'd be stuck. Once the sun comes up it'd cook. That'd dry it out.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: You think you can catch that thing?

Speaker: una
Dialogue: Sure 'tis lepping about all over the shop.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Have you got the keys to your truck?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: They'd be in the kitchen.     On the table, I think.

Speaker: una
Dialogue: You can't go downstairs, those things will tear you to pieces.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: You might not get past them, but someone else could.

Speaker: fr potts
Dialogue: You'd be talking about the drunkest person we got.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Absolutely not, it's too risky. Paddy you go.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: What?   Feck off!   Brian should go.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Slow down there. I'll do it.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Which is exactly why you'll want the best drunken guard this country's ever seen. Right?

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: If you get in trouble.      Pull the trigger.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Just get the keys and come right back. I'll do the rest.

Speaker: una
Dialogue: Look what they've done to the carpets!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: How are you gonna get to the truck?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I got it. If its you it wants, then we give it what it wants. We fashion a dummy, dress it up like bait and confuse the shite out of it. It won't know where to look when there's two of you.

Speaker: fr potts
Dialogue: And how the hell do we make a dummy?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: What is she doing at all?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Yoohoo! Come and get me, you rotten bastard!

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Would ya come on for fuck sake!

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: I'm breaking so many laws. Drinking on duty. Driving under the influence. Speeding. Driving without lights on.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Let's bury the hatchet, Paddy... into the heads of those feckin' things!

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: It's following me, so you get the crusher and I'll lure it into position.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: The crusher, the JCB. It's gone. It's not here anymore.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: What are we gonna do now?

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: -- the wrong keys. It won't open.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: ... Breaking and entering.   Jacking a stolen vehicle ...

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: Come on, you langer. Just a little closer. Move. Hey, you want me, you're going have to come across and get --

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: I think this calls for a celebration.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: I think I'll take some time-off.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: You know if you lived here you'd be home already.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Home of the Erin Island Grabbers. It's gonna get mental round here.

Speaker: o'shea
Dialogue: I'll need all the help I can get.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: You want to get some breakfast?

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: First, lets get out of these wet clothes.
